column3: REC-003
column4:
As an HR Manager, I want to define standardized job description templates, so that postings are consistent.
 Each job requisition must include Job details (title, department, location, openings) and Qualifications and skills needed.
column8: Each job requisition must include Job details (title, department, location, openings) and Qualifications and skills needed.

column3: REC-004
column4:
As an HR Manager, I want to be able to establish hiring processes templates so that the system can automatically update progress percentage.
 Each application must be tracked through defined stages (e.g., Screening, Shortlisting, Interview, Offer, Hired).
column8: Each application must be tracked through defined stages (e.g., Screening, Shortlisting, Interview, Offer, Hired).

column3: REC-023
column4: As a HR Employee, I want to preview and publish jobs on the company careers page with employer-brand content, so openings look professional.
column8: The system must allow automatic posting of approved requisitions to internal and external career sites.

column3: REC-007
column4: As a Candidate, I want to upload my CV and apply for positions, so that I can be considered for opportunities.
column8: The system must support the storage/upload of applications with resumes, which creates the organization's talent pool.

column3: REC-017
column4: As a Candidate, I want to receive updates about my application status, so that I know where I stand.
column8: Candidate Status Tracking must be easily visualized and up-to-date in real-time. The system must send automated alerts/emails to candidates regarding status updates.

column3: REC-022
column4: As a HR Employee, I want automated rejection notifications and templates, so candidates are informed respectfully and consistently.
column8: The system must support email templates for communication (e.g., rejection). Communication logs must be stored in the applicant profile.

column3: REC-008
column4: As a HR Employee, I want to track candidates through each stage of the hiring process, so that I can manage progress.
column8: Applications must be tracked through defined stages. Recruiters and hiring managers must be notified of status changes via alerts or workflow emails.

column3: REC-010
column4: As a HR Employee, I want to schedule and manage interview invitations, so that candidates are engaged efficiently.
column8: Recruiters must be able to schedule interviews by selecting time slots, panel members, and modes. Interviewers must receive automatic calendar invites, and candidates must be notified automatically.

column3: REC-011
column4:
As an HR Employee, I want to be able to provide feedback/interview score for scheduled interviews for filtration.
 Recruiters must be able to schedule interviews by selecting time slots, panel members, and modes. Interviewers must receive automatic calendar invites, and candidates must be notified automatically.
column8: The system must allow adding comments and ratings at each stage. Feedback at each stage must be submitted by the panel/interviewers to ensure accuracy.

column3: REC-020
column4: As an HR Employee, I want structured assessment and scoring forms per role, so evaluations are consistent and auditable.
column8: Criteria used in interview assessment are pre-set and agreed upon. The system needs to allow/house the multiple assessment tools to be used.

column3: REC-021
column4: As a HR Employee, I want to coordinate interview panels (members, availability, scoring), so scheduling and feedback collection are centralized.
column8: Interview scheduling requires selecting panel members. Panels need to possess the knowledge and/or training to conduct the needed interviews/selection tests.

column3: REC-030
column4: As a HR Employee, I want to be able to tag candidates as referrals in order to give them a higher chance of having an earlier interview.
column8: Electronic screening includes rule-based filters. Tie-Breaking Rules should be predetermined and could be based on Internal candidate preference.

column3: REC-009
column4: As an HR Manager, I want to monitor recruitment progress across all open positions, so that I stay informed.
column8: Multiple reports could be generated like time-to-hire and source effectiveness.

column3: REC-028
column4: As a Candidate, I want to give consent for personal-data processing and background checks, so the system remains compliant with privacy laws.
column8: Storing the talent pool needs to be authorized by applicants in the early stages of the recruitment process. All data handling must comply with GDPR and labor laws.

column3: REC-014
column4: As an HR Manager, I want to manage job offers and approvals, so that candidates can be hired smoothly.
column8: The system must support securing related parties’ approval before sending out the offer. Once candidate acceptance is received, the next module (Onboarding) should be triggered.

column3: REC-018
column4: As a HR Employee/HR Manager, I want to generate, send and collect electronically signed offer letters, so candidates can accept offers quickly and legally.
column8: The system supports issuing an offer letter which needs to be customizable and editable (e.g., include compensation/benefits). Communication logs must be stored.

column3: REC-029
column4: As a HR Employee, I want to trigger pre-boarding tasks (contract signing, forms) after offer acceptance and before the start date, so new hire readiness is improved.
column8: Once a candidate’s acceptance is received, the next module (Onboarding) should be triggered.

column4: As an Candidate, I want to upload signed contract and candidate required forms and templates to initiate the on boarding process.

column3: ONB-001
column4: As an HR Manager, I want to create onboarding task checklists, so that new hires complete all required steps.

column3: ONB-002
column4: As an HR Manager, I want to be able to access signed contract detail to be able create an employee profile.

column3: ONB-004
column4: As a New Hire, I want to view my onboarding steps in a tracker, so that I know what to complete next.
column8: The orientation program must include an onboarding workflow and support department-specific tasks and training plans.

column3: ONB-005
column4: As a New Hire, I want to receive reminders and notifications, so that I don’t miss important onboarding tasks.
column8: The system must support sending reminders and task assignments to responsible parties, and track delivery and status accordingly.

column3: ONB-007
column4: As a New Hire, I want to upload documents (e.g., ID, contracts, certifications), so that compliance is ensured.
column8: Documents must be collected and verified by the HR department before the first working day.

column3: ONB-009
column4: As a System Admin, I want to provision system access (payroll, email, internal systems), so that the employee can work.
column8: Auto onboarding tasks are generated for IT (allocation of email, laptop, system access).

column3: ONB-012
column4: As a HR Employee, I want to reserve and track equipment, desk and access cards for new hires, so resources are ready on Day 1.
column8: Auto onboarding tasks are generated for Admin (allocation and assignment of workspace, ID badge).

column3: ONB-013
column4: As a HR Manager, I want automated account provisioning (SSO/email/tools) on start date and scheduled revocation on exit, so access is consistent and secure.
column8: IT (allocation of email, laptop, system access) is an automated task. The system should allow onboarding cancellation/termination of the created employee profile in case of a "no show".

column3: ONB-018
column4: As a HR Manager, I want the system to automatically handle payroll initiation based on the contract signing day for the current payroll cycle. just setting start date if done in any prev phase you can skip since it is handled
column8: Auto onboarding tasks are generated for HR (payroll & benefits’ creation). This relates to the Payroll requirement REQ-PY-23 to automatically process payroll initiation.

column3: ONB-019
column4: As a HR Manager, I want the system to automatically process signing bonuses based on contract after a new hire is signed. which means you need to trigger service that fills collection that relates user to signing Bonuswhich is in payroll execution module
column8: This relates to the Payroll requirement REQ-PY-27 to automatically process signing bonuses

column3: OFF-001
column4: As an HR Manager, I want to initiate termination reviews based on warnings and performance data / manager requests, so that exits are justified.
column8: Employee separation needs an effective date and a clearly stated and identified reason for exit. Termination reviews based on performance must follow due process.

column3: OFF-006
column4: As an HR Manager, I want an offboarding checklist (IT assets, ID cards, equipment), so no company property is lost.

column3: OFF-007
column4: As a System Admin, I want to revoke system and account access upon termination, so security is maintained.

column3: OFF-010
column4: As HR Manager, I want multi-department exit clearance sign-offs (IT, Finance, Facilities, Line Manager), with statuses, so the employee is fully cleared.
column8: Clearance checklist required across departments (IT, HR, Admin, Finance). Final approvals/signature form should be filed to HR to complete the offboarding process.

column3: OFF-013
column4: As HR Manager, I want to send offboarding notification to trigger benefits termination and final pay calc (unused leave, deductions), so settlements are accurate. which means you need to trigger service that fills collection that relates user to benefit which is in payroll execution module
column8: Leaves’ Balance must be reviewed and settled (unused annuals to be encashed). Benefits plans are set to be auto-terminated as of the end of the notice period.

column3: OFF-018, OFF-019
column4: As an Employee, I want to be able to request a Resignation request with reasoning. As an Employee, I want to be able to track my resignation request status.
column8: Employee separation can be triggered by resignation. A clearly identified offboarding approval workflow should be identified (e.g., Employee resigning > Line Manager > Financial approval > HR processing/approval).

column1: Workflow: Minimized Recruitment, Onboarding, and Offboarding
The workflow traces the sequence of actions starting from job definition (Recruitment) through new hire setup (Onboarding) and finally through separation (Offboarding).
This phase manages attracting and selecting candidates, culminating in a signed offer and the triggering of pre-boarding tasks.

HR Manager defines standardized job description templates.
HR Manager establishes hiring process templates for stages and progress updates.
HR Employee previews and publishes jobs on the company careers page.
Candidate uploads CV and applies for a position.
Candidate gives consent for personal-data processing.
HR Employee tags candidates as referrals.
HR Employee tracks candidates through each stage of the hiring process.
HR Manager monitors recruitment progress across open positions.
HR Employee uses structured assessment and scoring forms per role.
HR Employee schedules and manages interview invitations.
HR Employee coordinates interview panels.
HR Employee provides feedback/interview score for filtration.
Candidate receives updates about application status.
HR Employee sends automated rejection notifications.
HR Manager manages job offers and approvals.
HR Employee/Manager generates, sends and collects electronically signed offer letters.
HR Employee triggers pre-boarding tasks after offer acceptance.

column1: This phase focuses on transitioning the accepted candidate to an active employee, ensuring compliance, resource allocation, and initial payroll setup.

column3: User Story Summary / Action
HR Manager creates onboarding task checklists.
HR Manager accesses signed contract detail to create an employee profile.
New Hire uploads compliance documents (e.g., ID, certifications).
HR Employee reserves and tracks equipment, desk and access cards.
System Admin provisions system access (payroll, email, internal systems).
HR Manager ensures automated account provisioning on start date and scheduled revocation on exit.
New Hire views onboarding steps in a tracker.
New Hire receives reminders and notifications.
HR Manager initiates system to automatically handle payroll initiation based on contract signing.
HR Manager initiates system to automatically process signing bonuses.

column1: This phase manages the compliant separation of the employee, whether due to resignation or termination, focusing on asset recovery and final settlements.

column3: User Story Summary / Action
Employee requests a Resignation request with reasoning.
Employee tracks resignation request status.
HR Manager initiates termination reviews based on warnings and performance data/manager requests.
HR Manager uses an offboarding checklist for asset recovery (IT assets, ID cards, equipment).
HR Manager obtains multi-department exit clearance sign-offs (IT, Finance, Facilities, Line Manager).
System Admin revokes system and account access upon termination.
HR Manager sends offboarding notification to trigger benefits termination and final pay calc
Action / Process
column4: Supporting User Stories (US) and Rules (BR)

column3: Define standardized job description templates [REC-003] and establish hiring process templates [REC-004].
column4: US: REC-003, REC-004. BR: Process template defines stages and progress percentage.
column5: Output: Standardized Templates (Stored). Data Flow: Consumed by job posting (REC-023).

column3: Preview and publish jobs on the company careers page [REC-023].
column4: US: REC-023. BR: Posting must be automatic once approved.
column5: Output: Active Job Posting (Live). Data Flow: Feeds job list to Candidate Dashboard. Updates Org Structure (position marked “Vacant”).

column3: Upload CV [REC-007] and give consent for personal-data processing [REC-028].
column4: US: REC-007, REC-028. BR: Storing applications requires applicant authorization.
column5: Output: Applicant Record; Consent Logged. Data Flow: CV stored in Talent Pool; consent enables compliance checks.

column3: Tag candidates as referrals [REC-030] and track candidates through each stage of the hiring process [REC-008].
column4: US: REC-030, REC-008. BR: Applications tracked through defined stages. Referrals get preferential filtering.
column5: Output: Updated Candidate Status; Referral Tagged. Data Flow: Status change triggers notifications (N-004).

column3: Use structured assessment and scoring forms per role [REC-020], coordinate interviews [REC-021], and schedule/manage invitations [REC-010].
column4: US: REC-020, REC-021, REC-010, REC-011. BR: Structured assessment forms required; ranking rules enforced.
column5: Output: Interview Feedback / Score Completed. Data Flow: Scores logged to candidate record for ranking.

column3: HR monitors recruitment progress [REC-009]; candidates get automatic updates [REC-017].
column4: US: REC-009, REC-017. BR: Status tracking must be real-time and visualized; automated notifications required.
column5: Output: Progress Dashboard View; Status Notifications (N-051). Data Flow: Consumes pipeline data.

column3: Manage job offers and approvals [REC-014]; generate and send e-signed offers [REC-018]; send automated rejections [REC-022]; trigger pre-boarding [REC-029].
column4: US: REC-014, REC-018, REC-022, REC-029. BR: Offer acceptance triggers Onboarding; offer data used for contract creation.
column5: Output: Signed Offer Letter (Stored); Rejection Sent. Data Flow: Triggers Onboarding initiation; data populates Employee Profile.

column3: Create onboarding task checklists [ONB-001]; access signed contract to create employee profile [ONB-002].
column4: US: ONB-001, ONB-002. BR: Triggered by offer acceptance; checklists customizable.
column5: Output: Employee Profile (Active); Onboarding Checklist (Activated). Data Flow: Uses signed contract data from Recruitment; outputs to Employee Profile.

column3: View onboarding tracker [ONB-004]; receive reminders [ONB-005]; upload compliance documents [ONB-007].
column4: US: ONB-004, ONB-005, ONB-007. BR: Tracker and reminders required; documents stored securely.
column5: Output: Documents Uploaded (Stored); Task Progress Updated. Data Flow: Documents stored in Employee Profile.

column3: Reserve and track equipment [ONB-012]; provision secure system access [ONB-009].
column4: US: ONB-012, ONB-009. BR: IT and payroll access automated; all resources tracked.
column5: Output: Access Granted; Equipment Reserved. Data Flow: Logged for audit; feeds Time Management (clock access).

column3: Automate payroll initiation upon contract signing [ONB-018]; process signing bonuses [ONB-019].
column4: US: ONB-018, ONB-019. BR: Bonuses treated as distinct payroll components; payroll trigger automatic.
column5: Output: Payroll Initiation Triggered; Bonus Processed. Data Flow: Triggers payroll processing steps (REQ-PY-23, REQ-PY-27).

column3: Schedule automatic provisioning and revocation of accounts [ONB-013].
column4: US: ONB-013. BR: Provisioning and security must be consistent.
column5: Output: Scheduled Revocation Flag. Data Flow: Info passed to Offboarding (OFF-007) for security control.

column3: Employee submits resignation [OFF-018] or HR initiates termination review [OFF-001].
column4: US: OFF-018, OFF-019, OFF-001. BR: Separation may result from resignation or termination; justification mandatory.
column5: Output: Resignation Request Submitted; Termination Review Started. Data Flow: Status triggers workflow approval.

column3: Manage offboarding checklist and departmental sign-offs (IT, Finance, Facilities, etc.) [OFF-006, OFF-010].
column4: US: OFF-006, OFF-010. BR: Multi-department clearance required; completion tracked.
column5: Output: Offboarding Checklist Active; Clearance Sign-offs Logged. Data Flow: Clearance governs final payroll release.

column3: Revoke system and account access on termination [OFF-007].
column4: US: OFF-007. BR: Access revocation required for security.
column5: Output: Access Disabled (Logged). Data Flow: Logs stored in audit trail; confirms ONB-013 revocation.

column3: Trigger final pay calculation and benefits termination [OFF-013].
column4: US: OFF-013. BR: Final pay includes unused leave, deductions, loans, severance; benefits auto-terminate.
column5: Output: Final Pay Calculation Triggered; Benefits Termination Scheduled. Data Flow: Sends encashment data from Leaves; triggers Payroll processing.
